Tucson opens the passenger's side door for Perceptor, hearing that he was o=
n that side.  He was happy to have passengers, because to him, having his c=
omrades around was a great comfort.  

"Of course Perceptor, hop in, my doo=
r is open on the passenger side.  I just wish I could take all of you somew=
here where we've all never been before, but without my visual sensors, I'm =
afraid my journeys are a bit restricted to sonar range.  I promise all of y=
ou though, that as soon as I am repaired, I would like to explore this plan=
et with all of you, after we settle this crisis we're undergoing now."

He =
had forgotten to talk to Perceptor not only as a leader, but as a friend.  =
This was a great opportunity to do just that.

" Perceptor, I've been meani=
ng to tell you something for a while, and I'm sorry it wasn't right away.  =
But we have some time now, and I want you to know that I don't want you to =
feel enslaved under my command, I want you to know that you can always talk=
 to me as a friend, and formality isn't a must around me.  All I ask is tha=
t you do your best, and if you don't succeed at something, do not hold that=
 against you.  Everyone comes to a road block sooner or later, but those ro=
ad blocks end up being learning experiences and when you come to it again, =
you learn how to get around it.  That's how I want you and everyone else to=
 feel.  Of course, the only thing that will bother me, is malice among comr=
ades.  Other than that, I am by no means the punnishing type.  And if I've =
forgotten to say this, I'm saying it now.  Welcome to my aliance.  Your ski=
lls are most valuable to our factions, and I'm honored to have you among us=
."
